extra.howItWorks: Amlodipine belongs to a class of drugs called calcium channel blocker. It reduces the amount of calcium that enters the smooth muscles of the blood vessels and heart. As muscle cells require calcium to contract, reducing the flow of calcium causes the muscle cells to relax and blood vessels to dilate, reducing blood pressure, force and rate of the heartbeat. It improves blood and oxygen supply to the heart muscles.
extra.sideEffects: Fainting, Chest pain, Extreme tiredness, Dizziness, Facial flushing, Upset stomach, Swelling of hands and feet, Abdominal or stomach pain, Lightheadedness, Drowsiness, Pounding heartbeat, Andheadache
extra.usage: Amlodipine is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and severe pain in chest.

extra.howItWorks: Atenolol belongs to class of medications called beta blockers. It acts by blocking receptors (beta-1 adrenergic receptor) in the heart and peripheral blood vessels resulting in slowing of heart rate and relaxing of blood vessels thereby lowering blood pressure. Atenolol reduces oxygen requirement at any level of activity making it useful for long-term management of heart attacks caused by restricted blood flow to the heart.
extra.sideEffects: Fainting, Cough or shortness of breath, Swelling of hands and feet, Cns depression, Drowsiness, Dizziness or lightheadedness, Rapid weight gain, Diarrhea and nausea, Excessive tiredness
extra.usage: Atenolol is used to control high blood pressure (hypertension), prevent chest pain (angina), treat uneven heart beats (arrhythmias) and in the early treatment following a heart attack (myocardial infarction).

extra.howItWorks: Aspirin (acetyl salicylic acid) is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug. Aspirin reduces the production of a chemical (prostaglandin) in the body by blocking the enzyme that makes prostaglandins (cyclooxygenase). Therefore,  swelling, pain, and fever are reduced. This also helps in blood thinning and in preventing clotting.
extra.sideEffects: GI Bleeding, Bleeding, Tinnitus, Vertigo, Angioneurotic edema, Breathlessness, Rhinitis, Dizziness, Nausea, Gastric erosion, Hepatitis, Hepatomegaly, Eigastric discomfort, Gastric ulceration, Vomiting, Dyspepsia, Cerebral hemorrhage, Urticaria, Respiratory alkalosis, Airway obstruction
extra.usage: Aspirin is used to treat pain including headache, migraine, neuralgia, toothache, sore throat, pain in joints, period pains and to reduce fever. It is also used as an anti-platelet agent (blood thinner) to decrease chances of heart attack in patients.

extra.howItWorks: Rosuvastatin belongs to a group of medications called statins (lipid-lowering agents) or HMG CoA reductase inhibitors. It acts by blocking the enzyme HMG CoA reductase which is important for  formation of cholesterol, thus, lowering the blood lipid levels.
extra.sideEffects: Memory loss, Depression, Joint pain, Dizziness, Forgetfulness, Difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep, Headache, Constipation, Confusion, Stomach pain
extra.usage:
Rosuvastatin is used for the treatment of high cholesterol, high LDL, high triglycerides and low HDL in addition to diet, when response to non-medicine options (diet, exercise and weight loss) is not adequate.
It is also used to lower the risk of stroke, heart attack, or other heart complications in people who are at high risk of heart diseases, as an adjuvant to correction of the risk factors.

extra.howItWorks: Hydroquinone bleaches the skin by reducing the accumulation of skin pigment called melanin that causes darkening of skin. It interferes with the synthesis of melanin and hampers important processes within cells that produce melanin (melanocytes). The bleaching effect of hydroquinone is reversible (reversible depigmentation).
extra.sideEffects: Itchy, Inflamed skin  may occur occasionally. discontinue use and contact your doctor immediately, Mild to moderate irritation, Sore, Allergic skin reaction-red
extra.usage: Hydroquinone is used to gradually lighten the  skin that has become dark or skin that has developed dark patches due to many skin problems. These include melasma-skin darkening due to exposure to sunlight especially in women using oral contraceptives (birth control pills), during pregnancy, or on hormone replacement therapy during menopause (hormonal drugs to replace deficient hormones in the body), freckles (clusters of dark spots on cheeks, nose, arms, and upper shoulders that start appearing at a very young age) and solar lentigines (also called ‘age spots’ are brown or black spots on the face, hands, shoulders and arms-areas that get exposed to sun light).

extra.howItWorks: Hydrocortisone belongs to the class of medications called as corticosteroids. It works by preventing release of certain chemicals from the immune cells responsible for causing dryness, itching, oozing, and crusting of skin, thereby relieving the swelling and irritation associated with various skin disorders.
extra.sideEffects: Allergy, Skin thinning, Itchy with dry and/or cracked skin, Striae, Mild burning, Changes in skin colour, Acne, Worsening of the condition that is being treated
extra.usage: Hydrocortisone topical is used to treat mild to moderate inflammatory skin disorders such as eczema (itchy, oozing, and crusting skin rash), contact dermatitis (itchy, oozing, and crusting skin rash after contact with certain plants, cosmetics, irritants like detergents), insect bite reactions or psoriasis (a skin condition associated with red, raised, itchy and scaly patches).

extra.howItWorks: Tretinoin is a form of vitamin A and belongs to a group of medications called as retinoids. It helps the skin to renew itself (causing peeling) and prevents skin inflammation.

extra.howItWorks: Amlodipine belongs to a class of drugs called calcium channel blocker. It reduces the amount of calcium that enters the smooth muscles of the blood vessels and heart. As muscle cells require calcium to contract, reducing the flow of calcium causes the muscle cells to relax and blood vessels to dilate, reducing blood pressure, force and rate of the heartbeat. It improves blood and oxygen supply to the heart muscles.

extra.usage: Telmisartan belongs to a class of medicines known as angiotensin II receptor blockers. It is also used for kidney failure in patients with diabetes.

extra.howItWorks: Amlodipine belongs to a class of drugs called calcium channel blocker. It reduces the amount of calcium that enters the smooth muscles of the blood vessels and heart. It improves blood and oxygen supply to the heart muscles.

extra.howItWorks: Amlodipine belongs to a class of drugs called calcium channel blocker. It reduces the amount of calcium that enters the smooth muscles of the blood vessels and heart. As muscle cells require calcium to contract, reducing the flow of calcium causes the muscle cells to relax and blood vessels to dilate, reducing blood pressure, force and rate of the heartbeat. It improves blood and oxygen supply to the heart muscles.
extra.sideEffects: Fainting, Chest pain, Extreme tiredness, Dizziness, Facial flushing, Upset stomach, Swelling of hands and feet, Abdominal or stomach pain, Lightheadedness, Drowsiness, Pounding heartbeat, Andheadache
extra.usage: Amlodipine is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and severe pain in chest.

extra.howItWorks: Olmesartan belongs to a class of medications called angiotensin II receptor inhibitors. Angiotensin II is a chemical that causes muscles surrounding the blood vessels to contract, thereby narrowing the blood vessels. Olmesartan blocks the action of angiotensin II resulting in relaxation of blood vessels, and thus, reduces blood pressure.
extra.sideEffects: Hoarseness, Allergic reactions may include swelling of tongue, Difficulty in breathing, Diarrhoea, Swelling of face and lips, Swelling of hands and feet, Difficulty in swallowing, Weight loss
extra.usage: Olmesartan is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension), prevention and treatment of heart attack (Myocardial Infarction) and heart failure; when heart is unable to pump sufficient blood. It is also used in patients of diabetes with kidney failure.

extra.howItWorks: Amlodipine belongs to a class of drugs called calcium channel blocker. It reduces the amount of calcium that enters the smooth muscles of the blood vessels and heart. As muscle cells require calcium to contract, reducing the flow of calcium causes the muscle cells to relax and blood vessels to dilate, reducing blood pressure, force and rate of the heartbeat. It improves blood and oxygen supply to the heart muscles.
extra.sideEffects: Fainting, Chest pain, Extreme tiredness, Dizziness, Facial flushing, Upset stomach, Swelling of hands and feet, Abdominal or stomach pain, Lightheadedness, Drowsiness, Pounding heartbeat, Andheadache
extra.usage: Amlodipine is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and severe pain in chest.

extra.howItWorks: Telmisartan blocks the action of a substance (angiotensin II) responsible for narrowing of the blood vessels. It relaxes the blood vessels; thereby lowering blood pressure.
extra.sideEffects: Hypersensitivity reactions, Bloating, Low blood pressure, Cough, Rapid swelling of the facial skin, Muscle cramps and pain, Itching, Vomiting
extra.usage: Telmisartan belongs to a class of medicines known as angiotensin II receptor blockers. It is used to treat high blood pressure, prevention and treatment of heart attack (myocardial Infarction) and heart failure; when heart is unable to pump sufficient blood. It is also used for kidney failure in patients with diabetes.

extra.howItWorks: Aspirin (acetyl salicylic acid) is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug. Aspirin reduces the production of a chemical (prostaglandin) in the body by blocking the enzyme that makes prostaglandins (cyclooxygenase). Therefore,  swelling, pain, and fever are reduced. This also helps in blood thinning and in preventing clotting.
extra.sideEffects: GI Bleeding, Bleeding, Tinnitus, Vertigo, Angioneurotic edema, Breathlessness, Rhinitis, Dizziness, Nausea, Gastric erosion, Hepatitis, Hepatomegaly, Eigastric discomfort, Gastric ulceration, Vomiting, Dyspepsia, Cerebral hemorrhage, Urticaria, Respiratory alkalosis, Airway obstruction
extra.usage: Aspirin is used to treat pain including headache, migraine, neuralgia, toothache, sore throat, pain in joints, period pains and to reduce fever. It is also used as an anti-platelet agent (blood thinner) to decrease chances of heart attack in patients.

extra.howItWorks: Rosuvastatin belongs to a group of medications called statins (lipid-lowering agents) or HMG CoA reductase inhibitors. It acts by blocking the enzyme HMG CoA reductase which is important for  formation of cholesterol, thus, lowering the blood lipid levels.
extra.sideEffects: Memory loss, Depression, Joint pain, Dizziness, Forgetfulness, Difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep, Headache, Constipation, Confusion, Stomach pain
extra.usage:
Rosuvastatin is used for the treatment of high cholesterol, high LDL, high triglycerides and low HDL in addition to diet, when response to non-medicine options (diet, exercise and weight loss) is not adequate.
It is also used to lower the risk of stroke, heart attack, or other heart complications in people who are at high risk of heart diseases, as an adjuvant to correction of the risk factors.

This also helps in blood thinning and in preventing clotting.
extra.sideEffects: GI Bleeding, Bleeding, Tinnitus, Vertigo, Angioneurotic edema, Breathlessness, Rhinitis, Dizziness, Nausea, Gastric erosion, Hepatitis, Hepatomegaly, Eigastric discomfort, Gastric ulceration, Vomiting, Dyspepsia, Cerebral hemorrhage, Urticaria, Respiratory alkalosis, Airway obstruction

extra.howItWorks: Clopidogrel belongs to a class of medicines called antiplatelet. It’s a “blood thinner”. It works by blocking certain blood cells called platelets and prevents them from forming harmful blood clots. This "anti-platelet" effect helps keep blood flowing smoothly in your body.

extra.howItWorks: Amlodipine belongs to a class of drugs called calcium channel blocker. It reduces the amount of calcium that enters the smooth muscles of the blood vessels and heart. As muscle cells require calcium to contract, reducing the flow of calcium causes the muscle cells to relax and blood vessels to dilate, reducing blood pressure, force and rate of the heartbeat. It improves blood and oxygen supply to the heart muscles.

extra.usage: Lisinopril is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension), prevention and treatment of heart attack (Myocardial Infarction) and heart failure; when heart is unable to pump sufficient blood. It is also used in patients of diabetes with kidney failure.

Surfactant doesn't let the mucus to get stuck to the walls of airways and is easily coughed out.
extra.sideEffects: Burning sensation and pain while passing urine, Nausea, Difficulty in passing stools, Loose motions, Skin rashes, Heartburn, Itching
extra.usage: Ambroxol is used to treat certain diseases of the respiratory tract and to relieve cough associated with thickened mucous.

extra.howItWorks: Levocetirizine belongs to a group of medications called antihistamines. It acts by blocking a natural substance (histamine) that is produced in the body during an allergic reaction.
extra.sideEffects: Abdominal and stomach pain, Diarrhoea and vomiting, Dry mouth, Drowsiness, Excessive tiredness
extra.usage: Levocetirizine is used to treat symptoms of allergic conditions such as allergic fever (hay fever), year-round allergies like dust or pet allergies and chronic nettle rash.

extra.howItWorks: Amlodipine belongs to a class of drugs called calcium channel blocker. It reduces the amount of calcium that enters the smooth muscles of the blood vessels and heart. As muscle cells require calcium to contract, reducing the flow of calcium causes the muscle cells to relax and blood vessels to dilate, reducing blood pressure, force and rate of the heartbeat. It improves blood and oxygen supply to the heart muscles.
extra.sideEffects: Fainting, Chest pain, Extreme tiredness, Dizziness, Facial flushing, Upset stomach, Swelling of hands and feet, Abdominal or stomach pain, Lightheadedness, Drowsiness, Pounding heartbeat, Andheadache

extra.howItWorks: Atenolol belongs to class of medications called beta blockers. It acts by blocking receptors (beta-1 adrenergic receptor) in the heart and peripheral blood vessels resulting in slowing of heart rate and relaxing of blood vessels thereby lowering blood pressure. Atenolol reduces oxygen requirement at any level of activity making it useful for long-term management of heart attacks caused by restricted blood flow to the heart.
extra.sideEffects: Fainting, Cough or shortness of breath, Swelling of hands and feet, Cns depression, Drowsiness, Dizziness or lightheadedness, Rapid weight gain, Diarrhea and nausea, Excessive tiredness
extra.usage: Atenolol is used to control high blood pressure (hypertension), prevent chest pain (angina), treat uneven heart beats (arrhythmias) and in the early treatment following a heart attack (myocardial infarction).

extra.howItWorks: Aspirin (acetyl salicylic acid) is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug. Aspirin reduces the production of a chemical (prostaglandin) in the body by blocking the enzyme that makes prostaglandins (cyclooxygenase). Therefore,  swelling, pain, and fever are reduced. This also helps in blood thinning and in preventing clotting.
extra.sideEffects: GI Bleeding, Bleeding, Tinnitus, Vertigo, Angioneurotic edema, Breathlessness, Rhinitis, Dizziness, Nausea, Gastric erosion, Hepatitis, Hepatomegaly, Eigastric discomfort, Gastric ulceration, Vomiting, Dyspepsia, Cerebral hemorrhage, Urticaria, Respiratory alkalosis, Airway obstruction
extra.usage: Aspirin is used to treat pain including headache, migraine, neuralgia, toothache, sore throat, pain in joints, period pains and to reduce fever. It is also used as an anti-platelet agent (blood thinner) to decrease chances of heart attack in patients.

extra.howItWorks: Clopidogrel belongs to a class of medicines called antiplatelet. It’s a “blood thinner”. It works by blocking certain blood cells called platelets and prevents them from forming harmful blood clots. This "anti-platelet" effect helps keep blood flowing smoothly in your body.
extra.sideEffects: Acne-like rash, Easy bruising, Upper respiratory tract infection, Depression, Nausea and diarrhea, Chest pain, Arthralgia, Rhinitis, Dizziness, Urinary tract infection, Flulike syndrome, Andheadache
extra.usage: Clopidogrel is used to prevent blood clots (thrombi) forming in hardened blood vessels (arteries), a process known as atherothrombosis, which can lead to atherothrombotic events such as stroke, heart attack, or death.

extra.howItWorks: Amlodipine belongs to a class of drugs called calcium channel blocker. It reduces the amount of calcium that enters the smooth muscles of the blood vessels and heart. As muscle cells require calcium to contract, reducing the flow of calcium causes the muscle cells to relax and blood vessels to dilate, reducing blood pressure, force and rate of the heartbeat. It improves blood and oxygen supply to the heart muscles.
extra.sideEffects: Fainting, Chest pain, Extreme tiredness, Dizziness, Facial flushing, Upset stomach, Swelling of hands and feet, Abdominal or stomach pain, Lightheadedness, Drowsiness, Pounding heartbeat, Andheadache
extra.usage: Amlodipine is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and severe pain in chest.

extra.howItWorks: Lisinopril belongs to group of medicines called angiotensin-converting-enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. It acts by inhibiting production of chemical angiotensin II resulting in relaxation of blood vessels, and thus, reduces blood pressure.
extra.sideEffects: Dizziness, Cough, Allergic reaction, Parasitic Infestation, Low blood pressure usually related to suddenly standing up, Headache, Heartburn, Diarrhea, Lightheadedness, Muscle cramps, Excessive tiredness
extra.usage: Lisinopril is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension), prevention and treatment of heart attack (Myocardial Infarction) and heart failure; when heart is unable to pump sufficient blood. It is also used in patients of diabetes with kidney failure.

extra.sideEffects: Abdominal and stomach pain, Dizziness, Nausea, Abdominal cramps and bloating, Weakness, Fatigue, Diarrhea, Andheadache, Flu like symptoms
extra.usage: Thiocolchicoside is used (as an additive treatment) for relieving painful stiffness or constriction in various diseases of the muscles, nerves, spine and the joints.

extra.howItWorks: Amlodipine belongs to a class of drugs called calcium channel blocker. It reduces the amount of calcium that enters the smooth muscles of the blood vessels and heart. As muscle cells require calcium to contract, reducing the flow of calcium causes the muscle cells to relax and blood vessels to dilate, reducing blood pressure, force and rate of the heartbeat. It improves blood and oxygen supply to the heart muscles.
extra.sideEffects: Fainting, Chest pain, Extreme tiredness, Dizziness, Facial flushing, Upset stomach, Swelling of hands and feet, Abdominal or stomach pain, Lightheadedness, Drowsiness, Pounding heartbeat, Andheadache
extra.usage: Amlodipine is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and severe pain in chest.

extra.howItWorks: Olmesartan belongs to a class of medications called angiotensin II receptor inhibitors. Angiotensin II is a chemical that causes muscles surrounding the blood vessels to contract, thereby narrowing the blood vessels. Olmesartan blocks the action of angiotensin II resulting in relaxation of blood vessels, and thus, reduces blood pressure.
extra.sideEffects: Hoarseness, Allergic reactions may include swelling of tongue, Difficulty in breathing, Diarrhoea, Swelling of face and lips, Swelling of hands and feet, Difficulty in swallowing, Weight loss
extra.usage: Olmesartan is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension), prevention and treatment of heart attack (Myocardial Infarction) and heart failure; when heart is unable to pump sufficient blood. It is also used in patients of diabetes with kidney failure.

extra.howItWorks: Aspirin (acetyl salicylic acid) is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug. Aspirin reduces the production of a chemical (prostaglandin) in the body by blocking the enzyme that makes prostaglandins (cyclooxygenase). Therefore,  swelling, pain, and fever are reduced. This also helps in blood thinning and in preventing clotting.
extra.sideEffects: GI Bleeding, Bleeding, Tinnitus, Vertigo, Angioneurotic edema, Breathlessness, Rhinitis, Dizziness, Nausea, Gastric erosion, Hepatitis, Hepatomegaly, Eigastric discomfort, Gastric ulceration, Vomiting, Dyspepsia, Cerebral hemorrhage, Urticaria, Respiratory alkalosis, Airway obstruction
extra.usage: Aspirin is used to treat pain including headache, migraine, neuralgia, toothache, sore throat, pain in joints, period pains and to reduce fever. It is also used as an anti-platelet agent (blood thinner) to decrease chances of heart attack in patients.

extra.howItWorks: Clopidogrel belongs to a class of medicines called antiplatelet. It’s a “blood thinner”. It works by blocking certain blood cells called platelets and prevents them from forming harmful blood clots. This "anti-platelet" effect helps keep blood flowing smoothly in your body.
extra.sideEffects: Acne-like rash, Easy bruising, Upper respiratory tract infection, Depression, Nausea and diarrhea, Chest pain, Arthralgia, Rhinitis, Dizziness, Urinary tract infection, Flulike syndrome, Andheadache
extra.usage: Clopidogrel is used to prevent blood clots (thrombi) forming in hardened blood vessels (arteries), a process known as atherothrombosis, which can lead to atherothrombotic events such as stroke, heart attack, or death.

extra.usage: Clindamycin topical is used to treat severe acne (acne vulgaris) and vaginal infections caused by certain bacteria.

extra.howItWorks: Amlodipine belongs to a class of drugs called calcium channel blocker. It reduces the amount of calcium that enters the smooth muscles of the blood vessels and heart. As muscle cells require calcium to contract, reducing the flow of calcium causes the muscle cells to relax and blood vessels to dilate, reducing blood pressure, force and rate of the heartbeat. It improves blood and oxygen supply to the heart muscles.

extra.howItWorks: Atenolol belongs to class of medications called beta blockers. It acts by blocking receptors (beta-1 adrenergic receptor) in the heart and peripheral blood vessels resulting in slowing of heart rate and relaxing of blood vessels thereby lowering blood pressure. Atenolol reduces oxygen requirement at any level of activity making it useful for long-term management of heart attacks caused by restricted blood flow to the heart.
extra.sideEffects: Fainting, Cough or shortness of breath, Swelling of hands and feet, Cns depression, Drowsiness, Dizziness or lightheadedness, Rapid weight gain, Diarrhea and nausea, Excessive tiredness
extra.usage: Atenolol is used to control high blood pressure (hypertension), prevent chest pain (angina), treat uneven heart beats (arrhythmias) and in the early treatment following a heart attack (myocardial infarction).

extra.howItWorks: Acebrophylline, a xanthine derivative, belongs to a class of medication called bronchodilators. It blocks the intracellular enzyme (phosphodiesterases) followed by increase in level of messenger known as cyclic adenosine monophosphate, which promotes relaxation of bronchial muscles. extra.howItWorks: Amlodipine belongs to a class of drugs called calcium channel blocker. It reduces the amount of calcium that enters the smooth muscles of the blood vessels and heart. As muscle cells require calcium to contract, reducing the flow of calcium causes the muscle cells to relax and blood vessels to dilate, reducing blood pressure, force and rate of the heartbeat. It improves blood and oxygen supply to the heart muscles.
extra.sideEffects: Fainting, Chest pain, Extreme tiredness, Dizziness, Facial flushing, Upset stomach, Swelling of hands and feet, Abdominal or stomach pain, Lightheadedness, Drowsiness, Pounding heartbeat, Andheadache
extra.usage: Amlodipine is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and severe pain in chest.

extra.howItWorks: Olmesartan belongs to a class of medications called angiotensin II receptor inhibitors. Angiotensin II is a chemical that causes muscles surrounding the blood vessels to contract, thereby narrowing the blood vessels. Olmesartan blocks the action of angiotensin II resulting in relaxation of blood vessels, and thus, reduces blood pressure.
extra.sideEffects: Hoarseness, Allergic reactions may include swelling of tongue, Difficulty in breathing, Diarrhoea, Swelling of face and lips, Swelling of hands and feet, Difficulty in swallowing, Weight loss
extra.usage: Olmesartan is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension), prevention and treatment of heart attack (Myocardial Infarction) and heart failure; when heart is unable to pump sufficient blood. It is also used in patients of diabetes with kidney failure.
